DOCNAME: CASE OF DAMJANOVIĆ AND EUROMAG D.O.O. v. BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The second applicant is a privately owned company , founded by the first applicant in DATE , with its registered seat in ORG , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant requested a licence to build a petrol station on the main highway in GPE and GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Directorate ” ) rejected the request . The second applicant appealed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant initiated proceedings for judicial review before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the second applicant urged ORG to expedite the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decisions of DATE and DATE ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) on procedural grounds , and remitted the case to the ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the second applicant informed ORG that the decision of DATE had not been enforced yet .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected the second applicant ’s request . On DATE the second applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant complained to ORG about the inaction of the administration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . The decision was served on the second applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant initiated proceedings for judicial review with ORG seeking it to quash the decisions of DATE and CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL above ) . On DATE ORG referred the claim to ORG , as the competent court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the application for judicial review .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a request for an extraordinary review of the decision of CARDINAL DATE with ORG , which request was rejected as unfounded on DATE . That decision was served on the second applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant lodged a constitutional appeal before ORG ( “ the LAW ” ) complaining , notably , about the length of the above administrative proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal as unfounded . It noted that the relevant proceedings had lasted DATE and DATE in total , that CARDINAL different decisions had been rendered by the competent authorities and that , therefore , the length of the proceedings had not been excessive .
